Report Documentation¶

Using This Module¶

The general usage looks like this:

report = Report(title='File Title',
                author='Your Name',
                root='./',
                lhead='Date',
                chead='Document Title',
                rhead='Your Organisation',
                count_pos='cfoot',
                packages=['required', 'packages'])

report.new_section('Section Header',
                   'Section Body')
report.auto_generate(clean_tex=False)

Full Report Class Documentation¶

class paper_generator.Report(**kwargs)¶

A base class to structure, populate, and generate a PDF document.

__init__(**kwargs)¶

Generates a PDF report.

Parameters

  • author (str) – The author of the paper.

  • title (str) – The title of the paper.

  • toc (bool) – Display table of contents if True.

  • root (str) – The root directory.

  • glossary_file (str) – A file containing def/thm/cor/prop/lemma.

  • outline_file (str) – A file containing the section outline.

  • bib_file (str) – A file containing a bibliography.

  • refs ({str: str,..}) – A dictionary of labels and their associated environments.

  • packages ([str,..]) – Required LaTeX packages.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

add_to_section(title, content)¶

Add content to an existing section.

Parameters

  • title – The title of the section.

  • content – The content to append.

auto_generate(clean_tex=True)¶

Run all the steps necessary for pdf generation.

Parameters

  • dest – The directory in which to save the pdf.

  • clean_tex – Should the .tex file be deleted after generation? (Default value = True)

generate(clean_tex=True)¶

Generate the PDF.

Parameters

clean_tex – Should the .tex file be deleted after generation? (Default value = True)

initialize()¶

Prepare the LaTeX document.

  1. Load packages

  2. Insert headers and footers

  3. Add table of contents

  4. Make title

  5. Load outline

load_section_from_file(title, filename)¶

Replace the references in a file and create a section containing the result.

Parameters

  • title (str) – The name of the new section.

  • filename (str) – The filename of the file to import.

move_section(currentpos, newpos)¶

Change the position of a section.

Parameters

  • currentpos – The current position of the section.

  • newpos – The new position of the section.

new_section(title, content='')¶

Create a new section.

Parameters

  • title – The header for the new section.

  • content – The material to display in the new section. (Default value = ‘’)

static page_break()¶
prepare()¶

Add the created sections to the LaTeX file.

reorder_outline(ordering)¶

Reorder the outline.

Parameters

ordering – A list of integers representing the new positions.

sections_from_dict(sections)¶

Create new sections from a given dictionary.

Parameters

sections ({str: str,..}) – A dictionary of titles and bodies.
